page.title: 07Transport Flintham/Syerston.
page.content: The main line of communication in the area is the A46{Fosse Way.}Flintham has through traffic to surrounding villages but Syerston is a cul-de-sac. There is a daily{postal delivery service to both villages. Syerston has a sub- postmistress whereas Flintham only has a very limited service - once a week for two hours in the kitchen of the Old School, quite a social event for the retired people. Word of mouth is still the main form of communication. Both villages have noticeboards and a{newsletter.}Daily newspapers are delivered in both villages, a service organised by the vicar of Elston's wife. Most households have a car but a{bus {service}hourly along the Fosse joins us to Nottingham & Newark. A village bus connects Flintham with Bingham & Syerston has a taxi service.
